intro: Abutilon pauciflorum f. longicorniculatum, commonly known as the longhorned abutilon, is a variant of the abutilon plant characterized by its distinctive, elongated floral bracts. It is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions, typically featuring hairy, glandular stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, lantern-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which are often clustered in inflorescences. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses. The f. longicorniculatum form is distinguished by its longer, more pronounced bracts compared to the typical species.

This plant is commonly found in tropical rainforests and coastal areas within its native range. It thrives in humid, warm climates with well-drained soil.
